definition: to do at all costs/to make an all-out effort
all/whole/entire/every/complete
surname Quan
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
surname Li
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
to go/to visit (e.g. another country)/to attend (a banquet etc)

sentences.english: Sinatra always made it all about him, and this is maybe his best-ever performance.
sentences.chinese: 辛納屈一貫地全力以赴，而這次是他史上最棒的演出。

sentences.english: What does "we are all over this" mean?
sentences.chinese: “我們正全力以赴解決此事”是什麼意思？

sentences.english: The Government will work hard to achieve the objectives I have described.
sentences.chinese: 特區政府定當全力以赴，務求達到這個目標。

sentences.english: We are in a full-court press trying to get more cash.
sentences.chinese: 我們正全力以赴爭取更多的現金。

sentences.english: We must buckle down ourselves until we complete the tower.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須全力以赴直到我們完成了這座塔的興建。

sentences.english: The Chinese people have launched an all-out rescue and repair effort in disaster-stricken areas.
sentences.chinese: 中國人民已全力以赴展開一場災區營救和恢復工作。

sentences.english: Something Rusan Rice will be spared this time around.
sentences.chinese: 這次賴斯要全力以赴的做些事情。

sentences.english: We have to do our best to change our country of the poor at present.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須全力以赴改變國家的落後面貌。

sentences.english: The Dragon Boat Team competed with all their strengths in the competition.
sentences.chinese: 香港龍舟隊運動員在賽中全力以赴。

sentences.english: I went all out to pursue my goals.
sentences.chinese: 我全力以赴追求我的目標。

sentences.english: Now he is in trouble, we should go all out to help him.
sentences.chinese: 現在他正遇到了麻煩，我們應該全力以赴去幫助他。

sentences.english: For example, opening a retail food store can be an all-consuming endeavor.
sentences.chinese: 例如，開辦一家零售食品店需要全力以赴。

sentences.english: I will try my best. Good good study, day day up.
sentences.chinese: 我要全力以赴，好好學習，天天向上。

sentences.english: To effect objects so dear to every patriot I shall devote myself with anxious solicitude.
sentences.chinese: 爲達成每個愛國者的宿願，我將迫不及待地全力以赴。

sentences.english: When we youngsters get together and play, we're always raring to go.
sentences.chinese: 當我們年輕人在一起踢球的時候我們總是全力以赴。

sentences.english: He knows what he wants and he goes after it with all guns blazing.
sentences.chinese: 他知道自己想要的是什麼，並全力以赴的爲之努力。

definition: with all one's strength/full strength/all-out (effort)/fully (support)
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to strive one's hardest/to spare no effort
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
heart and soul/wholeheartedly
to try one's utmost/to strive
lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
to put one's all into the fight
to advance bravely
great effort/to strive/to try hard
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
unswerving/unflinching
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
to continue the struggle (idiom); to persist/unremitting efforts
brimming with confidence (idiom)
reckless/regardless of everything
